Class Game

java.lang.Object
  Game

public class Game
extends Object

This class represents a Connect-4 game.

Author:
Steven Bogaerts

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game(PlayerDef playerXDef,
            PlayerDef playerODef,
            int totalTime)
Creates a new Connect-4 Game object.

Parameters:
totalTime - the time in seconds allowed for one player. Use -1 to indicate no time limit. Otherwise, each player gets totalTime seconds across the entire game.) It's like a chess clock. Each time your program is asked for a move, the remaining time is passed as a parameter. Suppose you're playing a game with totalTime = 128 per player, your program has already used 20 seconds (timeLeft = 108), it is asked for a move, and takes 10 seconds to respond. Then the next time your program is asked for a move, timeLeft would be 98. If your program then used, say, 100 seconds for its next move, then it would forfeit the game.
Method Detail

humanVsHuman

public static void humanVsHuman()
A convenience method for starting a game between two human players.

humanVsHuman

public static void humanVsHuman(int totalTime)
A convenience method for starting a game between two human players, with a time limit.

humanVsRandom

public static void humanVsRandom()
A convenience method for starting a game between a human and a random player.

play

public void play()
Manages one entire game, calling the appropriate player definition for a move, handling display of information, timing, etc. The game always starts with player 'X'.

randomVsRandom

public static void randomVsRandom()
A convenience method for starting a game between two random players.

reset

protected void reset()
Resest this Game object, in preparation for another game between the same players.
